cw_models

Class ExamSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model
      • cw_models.ExamSession

  • public class ExamSession
extends Model
    An exam session is an on-line virtual "examination hall".

    It holds all the students who take the same test for a particular course at a particular time slot.
    In other words, an exam session is uniquely identified by a Course and a TimeSlot.
    Also it contains a number of ExamRecord, which is thought to be simply a test taking activity, as there will be a number of test-taking activities of various students going on concurrently in an "examination hall".

      • allocate

        public void allocate(Course course,
                     TimeSlot timeSlot)
              throws CMException
        treis to create an ExamSession for a specified Course at a specified TimeSlot.
        Parameters:
        course - the Course that this exam session is to be created for.
        timeSlot - the TimeSlot during which this exam session is carried on.
        Throws:
        CMException - a generic error indicating there is already an exam session for the specified Course at a specified TimeSlot
